I was totally floored by Bacoa's burger. I generally have lower expectations for a chain, but Bacoa blew them away.When you enter this place, you grab a tiny pencil and a checklist.  Use it to construct your personal burger masterpiece.  Hand it to the cashier, then take your light-up coaster thing to a table.  When your burger is ready, it is delivered to you.I went with La Bacoa (8.50 €) - bacon, cheddar, manchego cheese, pickles and mustard. Because I glossed over the fact that it came with bacon, I selected extra bacon for 1.20 € more.  Since I love bacon, this was merely a bonus.The burger was incredible.  Huge and packed with flavor.  I loved it.I subtract one star because my patatas rústicas were very dry.  They tasted like potatoes that had been cooked two days before and were reheated.  Considering how amazing the burger was, that was shocking.If you're looking to slay your appetite, Bacoa is a great option, especially when you've grown tired of tapas.
